main event: An unidentified bright orange object, about the size of a small button, was observed in Yakima, Washington on July 7, 1959.
interesting points: The object exhibited wavering, erratic movement, flying in rapid 360-degree patterns,The observation lasted for 6 minutes,The flight characteristics led investigators to suspect it was a probable meteor,Unidentified flying objects in the Yakima area were also reported in a congressional inquiry, Nearby military bases suggested that some sightings were friendly aircraft conducting routine missions.
witness description: No specific witnesses were confirmed in the report.
